title: Personal portfolio website for consulting outreach

requirements.text: Create a responsive personal portfolio website with clear navigation and the following sections: Hero/Intro (name, short positioning statement), About, Services (consulting offerings), Work/Projects (portfolio items), Testimonials (optional but supported), and Contact (email + social links).

quotes: I want to create a personal portfolio website so I can share them with people for consulting purposes

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders all listed sections with sensible default placeholder content in English.
Navigation allows jumping to each section (or routes to each section) on both desktop and mobile.
Layout is responsive and usable on common viewport sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop).

requirements.text: Implement a Projects/Work section that displays a list of portfolio items with: title, short description, role/stack (freeform text), and outbound links (e.g., live demo and/or repository).
acceptanceCriteria: Projects render from a single editable data source in the frontend (e.g., a typed array/object) without requiring backend changes.
Each project card supports 0â€“2 outbound links and handles missing links gracefully.
Project cards have consistent spacing, typography, and hover/focus states.

requirements.text: Add a Contact section suitable for consulting leads that includes: a prominent email link (mailto:), optional calendaring link placeholder, and social links placeholders (e.g., LinkedIn, X/Twitter, GitHub).

quotes: share them with people for consulting purposes

acceptanceCriteria: Contact section includes accessible link labels and opens external links safely (new tab with appropriate rel attributes).
Email link uses mailto: and is clearly visible on mobile.
All links can be configured via a single frontend configuration object.

requirements.text: Establish a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, component style) appropriate for a consulting portfolio and apply it consistently across all sections. Avoid blue & purple as the primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: A single theme is evident across headings, body text, buttons/links, and section backgrounds.
Primary palette does not use blue/purple as the main brand colors.
UI maintains good contrast and readable typography.

requirements.text: Add basic SEO and shareability metadata for the portfolio: page title, description, and social preview defaults (Open Graph/Twitter card) using placeholder values that the user can edit.
acceptanceCriteria: Document has a meaningful title and meta description (English placeholders are acceptable).
Open Graph and Twitter card meta tags are present with placeholder values.
Metadata values are easy to find and edit in the frontend codebase.

requirements.text: Generate and include the required static images in the app and render them from frontend static assets (do not serve images through the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI.
Images render correctly on the landing page on mobile and desktop.
No backend endpoints are introduced for serving images.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose those components instead.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing third-party authentication (only Internet Identity is supported, and it is not required for this portfolio).
Adding a real-time chat or messaging system.
Integrating external databases, CMSs, or third-party email providers.

required: Minimal geometric hero background illustration with warm neutral palette (hero-bg.dim_1600x900.png)
Simple monogram-style personal logo mark, high-contrast on transparent background (logo-mark.dim_512x512.png)
Subtle abstract section divider pattern, transparent background (section-divider.dim_2000x300.png)
